Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "isSameRoute test order" (#2155) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/2zlyzp6mm0](https://codesandbox.io/s/2zlyzp6mm0)

### Steps to reproduce
in the sample just click 'launch' and then 'fail'

in general

1. create a route in the router with a name and a component
2. pragmatically change to the component using this.$router.push({ name: xxx, params: yyy })
3. put some link/button inside the component that will call this.$router.push with the same name but different params


### What is expected?
in the sample: the text should update

in general:

The router should update this.$route.params according to the new values given, the "completion" callback should be called

### What is actually happening?
in the sample: the text is not updated

in general:

The router is not loading the new params, the "abort" callback is called

---
in the isSameRoute function there a several cases
when there is a 'path' it is tested before when there is a 'name'
'path' is mandatory, we cannot create routes without path
thus the "name/params" comparison is never triggered and vue-router considers that the page is the same and aborts the navigation

inverting the order of the tests (testing for name before path) will fix this issue but I do not know enough the vue-router internals do be sure it will not break some other functionalities

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: fix(slots): preserve reactivity inside of $slots, fix #7856
Issues.Body:
Previously $slots was not reactive which caused use cases such as
portal-vue to not update when the contents of the slots updated. This
was because there were no reactive properties accessed when using $slots
and renders were only being triggered by calls to $forceUpdate when slot
contents changed.

This change makes $slots reactive, so updates are detected appropriately
regardless of where the slot is used.

fixes #7856

Issues.Title: 2.5.14 introduces TypeError bind is not a function
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.14

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/bad4a8mb/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/bad4a8mb/1/)

### Steps to reproduce
Provide a non function to the `bind` utility method.

### What is expected?
In <= 2.5.13, it rendered but failed silently: https://jsfiddle.net/ujxu9mvd/. Not sure if we'd want to keep that expectation, but existing projects will fail to render completely. A dev-mode warning at the very least will be helpful in identifying the issue.

### What is actually happening?
Uncaught TypeError

---
The refactoring of the `bind` method to use the native bind, exposes a coding error when upgrading from 2.5.13. We have a fairly large codebase and one of the developers mistakenly added an object as a component method (eg. a global Vue events instance). It made its way into production and worked fine until upgrading to 2.5.14. It took a while to find it as there was no clear indication as to where the error was happening.

Some other devs experienced this as well:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/pull/7491
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/324672a4621a3123cac90b18d4b1818bb33dddc6

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "2.5.14 introduces TypeError bind is not a function" (#8017)

Issues.Title: Vue Selected Bind Does Not Work on Option Tags
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/jbenner/pen/geJqex](https://codepen.io/jbenner/pen/geJqex)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Instantiate a Vue instance with a `data` property named `locations` which is an array consisting of `['all', 'north', 'south', 'east', 'west']`.
2. Iterate over the locations in an `option` tag like so `<option v-for="location in locations" :selected="location === 'all'">{{ location }}</option>`.

### What is expected?
The `selected` attribute to be set on the "all" `option` element.

### What is actually happening?
The `selected` attribute is not being set.

---
I've also tried the following while attempting to debug but to no avail:

```
<option v-for="(location, index) in locations" :selected="index === 0">{{ location }}</option>
```

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vue Selected Bind Does Not Work on Option Tags" (#8016)

Issues.Title: Importing css always yields "file not found"
Issues.Body:
I'm trying to import `CSS` in a component inside the `style` sections and no matter what path I provide (which I have double checked and it is 100% correct), the app fails to build due to not being able to find that file. 

Assuming I have added `a.css` to the `assets` folder under the `src` folder which results in the following path `@/assets/a.css` or `./src/assets/a.css`, when I import the file with the following code, it always fails due to not being able to find the file. The same error happens when pointing to the `static` folder as well.

    <style scoped>
       @import '@/assets/a.css'
    </style>

How can this be done? I need to scope `CSS` to components and reuse them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Importing css always yields "file not found"" (#8010)

Issues.Title: Using v-if/v-else on two v-model'ed select elements mixing value and :value in their option sets produces incorrect option values.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17-beta.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/33427/](https://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/33427/)

### Steps to reproduce
Click the `Toggle Field` button twice.

### What is expected?
The first `select` element should show with the "Left" value selected. Also, the current value of `bar` should remain `left`.

### What is actually happening?
The first `select` element shows no selected item and the value of `bar` has changed to an empty value.

---
If one looks at the values that are set when selecting a new value of `bar`, two of the three option values are now incorrectly taken from the `foo` select.

This bug seems to only happen when one `select` sets `option` values using the `value` attribute while another select sets `option` values using value binding with `:value` (or `v-bind:value`).

It also only happens if *both* `select` elements have `v-model` set.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using v-if/v-else on two v-model'ed select elements mixing value and :value in their option sets produces incorrect option values." (#8009)

Issues.Title: Transition Filckering
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/31863/](https://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/31863/)

### Steps to reproduce
Create a transition effect on a page

### What is expected?
a fluid transition without flickering

### What is actually happening?
During the transition, at the step where the 'Original' DOM element is removed and before the 'Replacement'  is injected there is no 'filler', so the space occuped by the 'Orignal' become empty and generate the flickering because every DOM element next the 'Original' fill this empty space, and at the moment the 'Replacement' is injected the next DOM element are pushed to their original place

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Transition Filckering" (#8005)

Issues.Title: .sync doesn't work with kebab case update events
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/293614/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/293614/)

### Steps to reproduce
Just run the attached fiddle and click on Change Bar button.

### What is expected?
The `foo` prop in root component should be updated via .sync

### What is actually happening?
The `foo` prop doesn't get updated.

---
We are currently migrating from Vue 1 to Vue 2 and we need to stick with using kebab case when naming component and event names. .sync seems useful and less boilerplate and I think it should work with both casing camel/kebab too. 

Also I found the following in the docs at .sync Modifier: "That‚Äôs why instead, we recommend emitting events in the pattern of update:my-prop-name. " Which is kebab case but it doesn't work with sync.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".sync doesn't work with kebab case update events" (#8004)

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:

**Other information:**
Prevents `Property 'oldValue' is missing in type '{ name: string; value: string; }'.` when using directives in a render function (see test). 

There should probably actually be three different `VNodeDirective`s:
 - In `h('', data)` - mostly optional, not readonly
 - In `VNodeData` (returned from createElement) - normalised, not readonly
 - In `DirectiveFunction` - the current definition (before this change)

Issues.Title: isSameRoute test order
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/2zlyzp6mm0](https://codesandbox.io/s/2zlyzp6mm0)

### Steps to reproduce
in the sample just click 'launch' and then 'fail'

in general

1. create a route in the router with a name and a component
2. pragmatically change to the component using this.$router.push({ name: xxx, params: yyy })
3. put some link/button inside the component that will call this.$router.push with the same name but different params


### What is expected?
in the sample: the text should update

in general:

The router should update this.$route.params according to the new values given, the "completion" callback should be called

### What is actually happening?
in the sample: the text is not updated

in general:

The router is not loading the new params, the "abort" callback is called

---
in the isSameRoute function there a several cases
when there is a 'path' it is tested before when there is a 'name'
'path' is mandatory, we cannot create routes without path
thus the "name/params" comparison is never triggered and vue-router considers that the page is the same and aborts the navigation

inverting the order of the tests (testing for name before path) will fix this issue but I do not know enough the vue-router internals do be sure it will not break some other functionalities

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "isSameRoute test order" (#2155)

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.

Version: 2.8.1
My app is served under /app/, then I have config router as follow
```javascript
let router = new Router({
  mode: 'history',
  base: '/app',
  routes: [
    {
      path: '/',
      name: 'Index',
      redirect: {name: 'Home'}
    },
    {
      path: '/home',
      name: 'Home',
      component: Home
    },
    {
      path: '*',
      name: '/error',
      component: Error
    }
  ]
})
```
But I got this result
[http://localhost:8080/app/home](http://localhost:8080/app/home) to /home
[http://localhost:8080/app/Home](http://localhost:8080/app/Home)  to /home
[http://localhost:8080/App/home](http://localhost:8080/App/home) to /error
[http://localhost:8080/App/Home](http://localhost:8080/App/Home) to /error

Is it a bug???

And now I have modifed function getLocation to handle this case
```javascript
function getLocation (base) {
  var path = window.location.pathname;
  var lowerCasePath = path.toLowerCase()
  if (base && lowerCasePath.indexOf(base.toLowerCase()) === 0) {
    path = path.slice(base.length);
  }
  return (path || '/') + window.location.search + window.location.hash
}
```

Issues.Title: Extra params should be ignored
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I have a route defined like this:

```
{path: '/entities/:id', component: () => import("...."), name: 'entity', props: true}
```

Then, I have a loaded `entity` instance in my code, so in order to create a link, I need to write:

```
<router-link :to="{name: 'entity', params: {id: myEntity.id}}">Link</router-link>
```

Being lazy, I was slightly less explicit about params and relying on the fact that `entity` contains an `id` field required by the route, I have created the link in the following way:

```
<router-link :to="{name: 'entity', params: myEntity}">Link</router-link>
```

Glad it worked for quite a long time, until I discovered that all extra parameters are not ignored but added to the `<router-view>` element as html attributes. So, for example, if the `myEntity` contains a `name` property besides the `id`, the `id` prop is properly consumed by the component but all the others are left on HTML element produced by `router-view`.

```
<div name="Name from entity">
```

IMO, all extra parameters (not defined in the route) should be ignored and not passed as `props` to the element.

What do you think?

I know there are at least two solutions: 1. not being lazy and 2. use function mode of the `props` to extract only props that are defined in the route. But I think this should be a default behavior.

Fun fact: I have discovered it when `myEntity` contained a `hidden: true` property and it resulted in `hidden="true"` HTML attribute on the whole `router-view`. You can guess how big WTF I had when debugging it... :-)

### What does the proposed API look like?
API does not change.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extra params should be ignored" (#2151)

Issues.Title: Enhancement on reusable router view
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Use a shared router view among different route paths. I'm creating a dashboard dynamically, which only need three views:

1. List View
2. Create View
3. Edit View

Let's create three files: `PageList.vue`, `PageCreate.vue`, `PageEdit.vue`, and use them in routes.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
routes = [
   {path: '/users', component: PageList},
   {path: '/users/create', component: PageCreate},
   {path: '/users/:id', component: PageEdit},
   {path: '/posts', component: PageList},
   {path: '/posts/create', component: PageCreate},
   {path: '/posts/:id', component: PageEdit},
]
```

Currently, this won't work properly. Actually, it has a bug, the `poll` function will run infinitely when switching routes.


## Current Bug

If you have such routes, and using navigation guard, the `poll` function will run infinitely when switching routes.

```js
routes = [
   {path: '/users', component: PageList},
   {path: '/posts', component: PageList},
]
```

If you add a `console.log` here https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/history/base.js#L315
it will print log infinitely, because `instances[key]` will always be undefined.

My current solution:

```js
routes = [
   {path: '/users', component: Object.assign({}, PageList)},
   {path: '/posts', component: Object.assign({}, PageList)},
]
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enhancement on reusable router view" (#2142)

Issues.Title: Allow paths with trailing slash.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Right now if I specify a route with "path: '/about/'" and I redirect to it the browser URL will be set to '.../about'.

This creates various issues. For example, Google Analytics will report usage statistics about '/about' and '/about/' (the latter we get if the user arrives on our page at /about as the browser appends a slash). Clearly this should be fixed on our end and I'm sure there are a lot of other cases where this creates problems. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
Disclaimer: I don't know if this breaks something else.

It would be great if "path: '/about/'" would add a trailing slash when redirecting to the route.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow paths with trailing slash." (#2141)

Issues.Title: Router guard not working when coming from page its supposed to redirect if condition does not match
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/jrfd3x89/](https://jsfiddle.net/jrfd3x89/)

### Steps to reproduce
So I have three components, Secured, NonSecured and Dummy associated to three routes. Secured routes should be accessed only by users who has access. And the router guard checks for that. If the user does not have permission then navigating the user to NonSecured page. 
 if you navigate from Dummy to Secured you would be redirected to NonSecured which is what supposed to happen. but if you navigate from NonSecured to Secured page, then you would be allowed to access. 

### What is expected?
If I have router guard enabled for a route, then the route should not be accessed if the guard logic is not met.

### What is actually happening?
The protected route can be accessed if I navigate to the protected route from the page where it redirects if guard logic is not met.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Vue-Router seeks and makes use of the first anchor element inside the component
Issues.Body:
### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/250344/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/250344/) ### Steps to reproduce Make a `router-link` whose `tag` attribute is not `a`, and place an anchor element inside it. ### What is expected? The click listener should bind to self. ### What is actually happening? The click listener binds to the first inner anchor element, disregarding self. --- There are several things at play here: 1. I want the whole card to be user-clickable. 2. I prerender my pages using `prerenderer-spa-plugin` and I want only the title of the card to be an anchor element for SEO reasons. 3. Again for SEO reasons, I don't want the whole card to be an anchor element since it will also contain `Content` and `More content` as anchor text. Now I understand where this behavior is coming from, it's trying to prevent a child anchor from triggering a full page navigation. Without using `router-link` I can get the best of both worlds by making a clickable div whose event does not propagate and trigger the inner anchor while web crawlers still relate `/route/3` to `I am a good link`: ```

I am a good link

Content

More content

``` These lines are responsible for this behavior: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/9880cbda8dd299315a253abaab69da00eecdf635/src/components/link.js#L86-L99 Note a shortcoming of this implementation: should the user place more than one anchor element inside the `router-link`, only the first one will get enhanced while the other ones will still trigger a full page reload. To me that scenario makes little sense and I have no idea of any real use case, but perhaps it should raise a warning. Is there any 'official' stance on my workaround?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vue-Router seeks and makes use of the first anchor element inside the component" (#2134)

Issues.Title: Feature Request: watch
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
This solve doing 

store.watch multiple times

for example

store.watch multiple getter functions

### What does the proposed API look like?
when declaring a vuex store or module add a watch option on it
```js
Vuex.store({
  watch: {
    'getters.auth': {
       mutation: 'test',
       action: 'test',
       deep: true,
       immediate: true
     }
  }
})
```
Just the same idea with Vue JS API

https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#watch

Issues.Title: [feat] Add asyncData Method Type to ComponentOptions Module Augmentation
Issues.Body:
We use Vue SSR heavily at @algorithmiaio, and we've followed the [Vue SSR-sanctioned means of declaring async data methods](https://ssr.vuejs.org/en/data.html#logic-collocation-with-components).  We've shimmed together our own module augmentation for the `asyncData` method, but given the prevalence of `asyncData` usage throughout the Vue community, it would be nice to standardize the interface.

I was torn as per where this should live - there isn't a repo for SSR, given that it lives in the Vue repo, and ultimately it felt right here with the Vuex project, since `asyncData` and Vuex go hand in hand. 

I've added a test for the new type as well, and let me know if there's anything I can tweak. Cheers!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[feat] Add asyncData Method Type to ComponentOptions Module Augmentation" (#1214)
